sense.name: mottled fabric used for military uniforms
sense.examples: We spoke to two soldiers dressed in desert camouflage. This textile mill makes camouflage for military uniforms. The boys wore jungle camouflage to play paint ball in the woods.

sense.name: an outward semblance or appearance that is misleading
sense.examples: A polar bear's white fur is a good camouflage for hunting on icebergs and snow. Cut branches above the trenches served as camouflage for the tanks. His apparent indifference to winning the competition was a protective camouflage. (figurative)

sense.name: the act of concealing or disguising
sense.commentary: CAMOUFLAGE[+action][+concealing] Note: implies ongoing activity, not a static appearance (Sense 2)
sense.examples: Their agreeing to attend negotiations next month is just a camouflage to buy themselves more time. They conducted their affair under the camouflage of apparently working on reports late into the night.
